net.sf.mmm.util.datatype.api.color

Interface Segment<V extends Number>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - is the generic type of the value.
    All Superinterfaces:
    AttributeReadMaximumValue<V>, AttributeReadMinimumValue<V>, AttributeReadValue<V>, Datatype, Serializable, SimpleDatatype<V>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDoubleSegment, AbstractSegment, Alpha, Blue, Brightness, Chroma, ColorFactor, Factor, Green, Hue, Lightness, Red, Saturation

    public interface Segment<V extends Number>
extends SimpleDatatype<V>, AttributeReadMinimumValue<V>, AttributeReadMaximumValue<V>
    This is the interface for a single segment of a Color.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      int getValueAsPercent() 
      String toString()
      Returns the official String representation of this Datatype.

      String toStringAsPercent() 

      • Methods inherited from interface net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.SimpleDatatype

        getValue

      • Methods inherited from interface net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.attribute.AttributeReadMinimumValue

        getMinimumValue

      • Methods inherited from interface net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.attribute.AttributeReadMaximumValue

        getMaximumValue

    • Method Detail

      • getValueAsFactor

        double getValueAsFactor()
        Returns:
        the value in the range from 0 to 1 ([0, 1]).

      • getValueAsPercent

        int getValueAsPercent()
        Returns:
        the value in percent in the range from 0 to 100. Will be rounded to an int. If you want to keep (potential) precision, use getValueAsFactor() and divide by 100.

      • toStringAsFactor

        String toStringAsFactor()
        Returns:
        the value as String. E.g. "0.512".

      • toStringAsPercent

        String toStringAsPercent()
        Returns:
        the value as String formatted in percent. E.g. "51.2%".
        See Also:
        getValueAsPercent()

      • toString

        String toString()
        Returns the official String representation of this Datatype. While the general contract of Object.toString() is very weak and mainly used for debugging, the contract here is very strong. The returned String has to be suitable for end-users and official output to any kind of sink.
        ATTENTION:
        This method is not supposed to do internationalization (I18N). See NlsMessage for this purpose and implement NlsObject if you want to support I18N/L10N.
        Specified by:
        toString in interface Datatype
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        the default String representation. Depending on the type this might be the same as toStringAsFactor() but it might also be an absolute integer (e.g. in the range [0, 255] for RGBA segments).
